---
id: refresh-handler
title: ""
description: "The Refresh endpoint re-authenticates users and API keys using a refresh token rather than requiring a username and password or API key credentials a second time and returns a new access and refresh token pair with the current credentials of the user. This endpoint is intended to facilitate long-running connections to the systems that last longer than the duration of an access token; e.g. long sessions on the UI or (especially) long running publishers and subscribers (machine users) that need to stay authenticated semi-permanently."

import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Refresh"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/v1/refresh"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



The Refresh endpoint re-authenticates users and API keys using a refresh token rather than requiring a username and password or API key credentials a second time and returns a new access and refresh token pair with the current credentials of the user. This endpoint is intended to facilitate long-running connections to the systems that last longer than the duration of an access token; e.g. long sessions on the UI or (especially) long running publishers and subscribers (machine users) that need to stay authenticated semi-permanently.

  id={"request"}

</Heading>
